intro: Agrostophyllum isuaravum, commonly known as the Isuara Valley grass. It is a flowering plant species native to the remote highlands of New Guinea. This plant belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
